meanings.definition: Capable of being corrected or improved.
meanings.sent1: The essay had some emendable errors that needed fixing.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated receiving emendable feedback on her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The teacher found the student's attempt at drawing a cat with three legs quite emendable.
meanings.sent4: His emendable attitude towards learning made him stand out in the class.
meanings.sent5: The emendable nature of technology allows for constant advancements.

meanings.definition: Able to be amended or revised.
meanings.sent1: The contract was emendable, so they made the necessary changes.
meanings.sent2: The emendable document was updated to reflect the new regulations.
meanings.sent3: She found the recipe to be emendable, so she added more spices for flavor.
meanings.sent4: His emendable approach to problem-solving led to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The emendable nature of the law allows for flexibility in interpretation.
